attributes.action: Universal Partnership Passport Agreement that legally recognises a Spouse.
attributes.additional_details: Currently in the Family Law Act a Spouse is somebody who shares a child, shares a Marriage or resides with said partner for a 2 year period. A couple who live a great distance apart (Example: Serving member of the Armed Forces vs a couple that can spend everyday together would arguably be able to prove there is a legitimate partnership and should be recognised as a Spouse regardless of time factors, marital status or children. This would adhere to the Human Rights Act for the wider populous.
attributes.background: A Universal Partnership Agreement free from discrimination should be enforced in the UK. This would legally identify a couple as legal spouses regardless of Ethics, Religion or Social background. The Agreement should focus purely on the applicants. The process should be fair as possible.
